_header: Hail glorious Lady and heavenly queen
Note: First 7 stanzas have ‘c’ lines in Latin; final stanza English as conclusion.
Subjects: Virgin Mary, salutation to; hymns, to Virgin Mary

CamTCC601.First Lines:
hayle glorious lady & heuenly queneCrownyd & regnyng in
                    þe blysfull cage…
CamTCC601.Last Lines:
…Helpe vs fayre lady þys lyfe whyle we dryueAnd aftyr
                    oure endyng god sende vs heuyn Amen
CamTCC601.Attributed Author:
John Lydgate (added by later hand between last line and rubric
                        Explicit (f. 274vb)
CamTCC601.Attributed Title:
Hic sequitur Salutacio Angelica per dictum dompnum Johannem lydegate
                        translata (f. 274)
CamTCC601.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 280-2.
Saupe,  Karen,
                        ed.  
             Middle English Marian
                    Lyrics.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 1998: 58-60; 186-7.

Longleat30.First Lines:
HAyle glorious and heuen queneCrouned and reyned in the blysful
                    cage…
Longleat30.Last Lines:
…Help vs fayre lady this lyfe whil we drieAnd after oure
                    endinge got bringe vs to heueneAmen

HunHM142.First Lines:
HAyle glorious and heuen queneCrouned & reyned in þe
                    blysful cage…
HunHM142.Last Lines:
…Help us fayre lady þis lyf whil we drieAnd after oure
                    endyng god bringe us to heuen
HunHM142.Attributed Title:
Salutacio Angelica (f. 21); Here begynneth þe Aue maria
                    (f. 21)
